text: The University Club in Montreal, Quebec, or Le Club Universitaire de Montréal, associated with McGill University, was founded in 1906. Its building was completed around 1912, and is known as "University Club" or as Édifice du Club-Universitaire-de-Montréal. The building, completed in 1913, was designed by Percy Erskine Nobbs, an architect noted for his Arts and Crafts work. It was a traditional gentleman's club. The building was registered as a monument historiques du Quebec on September 29, 1986.Édifice du Club-Universitaire-de- Montréal In late 2017, the club was in the process of giving up its historic building. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Buildings and structures in Montreal Category:Heritage immovables of Quebec Category:Gentlemen's clubs in Canada Category:Organizations established in 1906 Category:1906 establishments in Quebec
title: University Club (McGill University)
